casebody.data:
LOCAL UNION NO. 72, UNITED ASSOCIATION OF JOURNEYMEN AND APPRENTICES OF the PLUMBING & PIPEFITTING INDUSTRY OF the UNITED STATES AND CANADA, Petitioner, Cross-Respondent, v. NATIONAL LABOR RELATIONS BOARD, Respondent, Cross-Petitioner. No. 29387

Summary Calendar.*

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Dec. 14, 1970. Robert L. Mitchell, Atlanta, Ga., for petitioner, cross-respondent. Walter C. Phillips, Regional Director, N.L.R.B., Atlanta, Ga., Arnold Ordman, Gen. Counsel, Dominick L. Manoli, Associate Gen. Counsel, Marcel Mallet-Prevost, Asst. Gen. Counsel, N.L.R.B., Washington, D.C., Abigail Cooley Baskir, Daniel M. Katz, Attys., N.L.R.B., for respondent, cross-petitioner.

Before THORNBERRY, MORGAN and CLARK, Circuit Judges.

Rule 18, 5th Oil’.; See Isbell Enterprises, Inc. v. Citizens Casualty Co. of New York et al., 5th Cir., 1970, 431 F.2d 409, Part I.

 PER CURIAM:

Enforced. See Local Rule 21.1

. See NLRB v. Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, 430 F.2d 966 (5th Cir. 1970).
